page.title: 03SOUTHSEA MUSEUMS
page.content: {CUMBERLAND HOUSE},a Georgian building,is Portsmouth's Natural History museum.The first room has several aquariums with different kinds of fish and a display of animals found along the river bank. On the first floor is a display and slide show about the Earth's geological history. Another interesting display is one on the Ice Ages and the evolution of man.The final display shows the variety of mammal, bird and insect life found about Portsmouth. {THE D-DAY MUSEUM}was opened in 1984 by the Queen Mother to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the D-Day landings on the 6th June 1944.The main exhibition is the D-Day tapestry which is 234 feet long and shows events from 1940 until the landings.There are displays of army equipment,the D-Day head- quarters and other war time scenes.
